intro: Gymnosporia cassinoides, commonly known as the African burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The species is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its ecosystem.
